data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You will only take 9 steps left going up and 10 steps forward going down. If you go left, you will go straight up and take 10 steps backward (toward the destination). If you go right at 9 steps, you will go straight up and take 9 steps backward (toward the destination). So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around, you will start at the halfway-point. The starting point is a starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point you will take 4 steps to go to the top of the escalator. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn left, you first have to turn left to take 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around to go back to the starting point. The first step was taken by taking 10 steps back, then 10 steps back. The second step was taken by turning around to go back to the starting point, then 3 steps back, then 3 steps back. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first 7 steps are right turns and 2 minutes equals 7 steps. The first 7 steps are turning around and 2 minutes equals 7 steps. The last 7 steps is turning right and 2 minutes equals 7 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right at the yellow stop sign. Enter the building and leave. Take 8 steps and take 9 steps to get back to at starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Since you are starting from the same point twice, adding the first one means you're in the previous direction. If you add the next step, you're in the previous direction with 6 steps to come. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The smallest amount of forward steps is one step. If one always begins facing forward, one will always return to the beginning point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first and last instructions return to the starting point. The first instruction takes 3 steps. The second instruction takes 9 steps. The third instruction takes 2 steps. The fourth instruction takes 7 steps. The fifth instruction takes 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
An out of step is the opposite of an in step. This means that to get back to the starting point, you’d have to take the step backwards. One could be facing forward for example. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If we face forward, we cannot take any steps backwards. We can take any steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you take 9 steps left, you go back to the point you started. When you take 10 steps left, you go back to the point you started near. When you go 6 steps left, you go left. When you move towards your starting point, you need to move to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps left and 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. To go back to the starting point, you need to walk 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
No one can return to their starting point at the same time. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first instruction refers to right, so is the first instruction. If you took 4 steps there, you took 8 steps. If you took 10 steps there, you took 10 steps. If you take 8 steps there, you took 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

When you return to the starting point after turning around, you go 0 steps back. The answer: No.

Turn around takes 9 steps. It’s safe to turn right. The starting point is inside this building (front of building). So, the answer is Yes.

Turn in the direction of travel from where you started. Go to the starting point.

In the first direction, turn right. In the second direction, turn right. Then repeat these steps in the third and fourth directions, until you get back to the beginning point. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step, Take 1 step, Take 3 steps, Turn left. Take 6 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

You will turn around to the left and it will take you 2 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 7 steps, you are back at the beginning point. If you take 3 steps, you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first way must be facing forward. The second way can only be taken backward. The third way backwards requires you to have taken 8 steps left. The fourth way forward requires you to have taken 7 steps left. The fifth way forward requires you to have taken 7 steps right. The sixth way forward requires you to have taken 7 steps right. The seventh way forward demands you to have taken 7 steps forward. The eighth way forward requires you to have taken 7 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Remember, when facing forward, you always face forward. If you face backward, you always face backward. Walking backward, you always turn around and walk to the left or right. Walking left, you always return to facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Every four steps you walk you will return to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is to face forward and you continue to move forward for 6 steps. The second step is to face right and you continue to move forward for 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person who turns right must return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you face forward your steps will always be moving forward. If you look backward you will take back less than 1 step. So, the answer is no.

If you are taking one step back, do you move to the next step? If you are taking 10 steps, you are only taking one step back. So, the answer is no.

Turning around does not need to be done after you have taken 9 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Steps out for the first few sets of directions are backward and 3 steps away for the second. There are 7 steps forward before moving backward. There are 8 steps backward before moving backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and turn around 2 times. Take 3 steps back to start with. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps forward and 10 steps backward. Repeat again after going 5 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

For the first 5 steps we always face forward. For the next 5 steps we face backward. The length of each step is different. The first five steps are repeated. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around is a tense action of walking around. 8 steps = 8 miles. 2 miles = 3 miles. 10 steps = 10 miles. Turn around is a tense action of walking around. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Remember, after you take 6 steps forward, you will always be facing forward. Obviously, taking 4 steps forward will get you to a different ending than taking 9 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions for a 5 step start is "Take 5 steps". The 5 steps ending in 5 mean that you should take 5 = 5 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. The starting point was facing forward. So, the answer is No.

You would take either 2 stepsbackward or 4 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

You take 10 steps to get back to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The directions always say take 5 steps right. The instructions are in no particular order. They say for each of the steps taken, take 1 step forward. If you do not take 1 step forward, then you do not return to the starting point. Then if you do take 5 steps right again, we come back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you move your body in any direction, they will always do the opposite.

This sentence follows from the way forward and backward directions. The instructions tell you to Always face forward, and all directions are from this point forward to the future. So, the answer is Yes.

You take 7 steps backward to go forward. You take 10 steps right to go right. You take 4 steps forward to go right. You take 1 step left to head left. Thus, the answer is No.
